column1: Gorbag was the captain of the Uruk-hai of Minas Morgul. He served the Nazgûl who dwelt in the Dead City.
During the peak of the War of the Ring
column2: the Two Watchers exhibited unease because a Hobbits
column4: had passed by them. Gorbag and a patrol then
column5: left Minas Morgul and were sent to Cirith Ungol where Shagrat was in command.

column1: On 13 March  Gorbag and Shagrat came across Frodo
column2: now paralyzed by Shelob. They ordered Frodo carried back into the Tower of Cirith Ungol as their prisoner.

column1: During their return to the tower Samwise Gamgee
column2: who was wearing the The One Ring
column3: overheard them talking. It quickly became apparent that Gorbag was the more observant of the two
column4: and noticed that the paralyzed halflings cords were cut
column5: meaning that he had a companion: Shagrat said that the Nazgûl were uneasy and that something nearly slipped
column6: and Gorbag corrected him saying that something had slipped; Shagrat pointed out that Shelob got the halfling
column7: but Gorbag pointed out that he was not alone
column8: as someone else cut the cords from Frodo. Shagrat dismissed Gorbags reasoning by claiming that he always took a gloomy view.  Shagrat
column9: who had been in the tower longer
column10: was able to tell Gorbag that Frodo was not dead.

column1: On 14 March the two Orc leaders stripped Frodo of his possessions.  Upon discovering Frodos Mithril#The Mithril Coat Gorbag tried to keep it
column2: which provoked a fight between the underlings of the two leaders.  Gorbag knifed Shagrat
column3: who in return attempted to throttle him. Later he attempted to stab Shagrat with a broken spear but Shagrat
column5: then stabbed him in the throat and trampled on his body.

column1: File:The Lord of the Rings - The Return of the King - Gorbag.jpg
2003: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King:

column2: Gorbag is portrayed as a smaller
column3: regular Orcs while Shagrat is an Uruk-hai. Instead of coming up from Minas Morgul
column4: he comes down with Shagrat from the Tower of Cirith Ungol and is the one that explains to the Orcs about Shelob and her choice to leave victims alive. Later
column5: he is killed by Samwise Gamgee.

column1: 2003: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (video game):
:Gorbag appears as a boss at the end of the "Cirith Ungol" level. In the game
column2: Gorbag knocks down Shagrat and then Sam must defeat him by stunning him with pikes.
